comments.author: superblade7715

comments.text:
These are not the words of an 11 year old.  This video may or may not be 
fake, but if it's real, this girl has been heavily coached on what to say.

I really don't think an arranged marriage is generally as bad as they're 
making it out to be.  Perhaps this girl had a bad experience.  She said she 
had a sister or something who covered herself with gas and lit herself on 
fire.  If that's true, perhaps she had a bad experience and is afraid.  But 
we have bad experiences with marriage in America as well.  My understanding 
is that we have much worse experiences with marriage on average than most 
arranged marriages.

11 is pretty young to be married, especially if there is sex involved at 
that age.  But I'm willing to bet there's more to this story than we're 
hearing.﻿
comments.author: imnotmike

comments.text:
+mwillblade I have no desire to decide who my daughter marries, personally. 
 But I do think that arranged marriages are better than choosing your own 
mate.  Our current system for marriage is so messed up, it does nothing but 
destroy lives.

I don't have enough experience with arranged marriages to know for sure, 
but from what I know it seems like a far superior system for 'choosing' a 
mate.

comments.text:
+Som Ebody It's not "god" that is evil, it is what the belief in a god 
makes people do. Many wars and forms of oppression have stemmed from 
conflict in beliefs. For example: in the U.S. there has been a continuous 
struggle for civil rights. First an end to slavery, then women's rights, 
African-American voting rights, interracial marriage, abortion and gay 
rights... Every time the more conservative side (basically God-fearing 
"republicans") tried to withhold rights from others. Just think of the 
abortion and gay rights movements now. The conservative CHRISTIANS are 
trying to restrict what other people do, even when it had nothing to do 
with them. And do not tell me it has nothing to do with religion.

comments.text:
Ibn ‘Abd al-Barr (may Allaah have mercy on him) said:
The scholars are unanimously agreed that the rapist is to be subjected to 
the hadd punishment if there is clear evidence against him that he deserves 
the hadd punishment, or if he admits to that. Otherwise, he is to be 
punished (i.e., if there is no proof that the hadd punishment for zina may 
be carried out against him because he does not confess, and there are not 
four witnesses, then the judge may punish him and stipulate a punishment 
that will deter him and others like him). There is no punishment for the 
woman if it is true that he forced her and overpowered her, which may be 
proven by her screaming and shouting for help.

Yes, women belong to men but men belong to women, too.
Not in a sense as they own eachother like animals, they just have rights 
over each other.
